definition: seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: The remaining places on the Middletons' front row are yet to be confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 剩餘的座位安排尚有待確定。

sentences.english: Such as the need to occupy a separate seat, the child should be the purchase of tickets.
sentences.chinese: 如需要單獨佔用座位時，應購買兒童票。

sentences.english: Your lifejacket is located under your seat or beneath your central arm rest.
sentences.chinese: 你的救生衣裝在座位下或者中央扶手下面。

sentences.english: Please resume your seats, as the performance will continue in two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 請回到你們的座位上，表演兩分鐘後將繼續進行。

sentences.english: Please put your seat and tray table in upside and locked position.
sentences.chinese: 請將您的座位和桌板調至垂直狀態並固定。

sentences.english: Our seats are in the grandstand.
sentences.chinese: 咱們的座位在正面看臺。

sentences.english: Wing section and survival rates as second-class cabin seats 56%.
sentences.chinese: 機翼段和二等艙段座位的生還率同爲56%。

sentences.english: But Taka was already out of his seat and running.
sentences.chinese: 但高井早巳離開座位跑了起來。

sentences.english: He's here but he's not at his dest right now.
sentences.chinese: 他有來上班，不過現在不在座位上。

sentences.english: I am sorry, you haven't reconfirmed your seat.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，您還沒有確認您的座位。

sentences.english: Seats are limited and will be available on first-reply-first-serve basis.
sentences.chinese: 座位有限及採用先回覆先留位的方法。
我們還是買露天看臺座位好了。

sentences.english: When the panels started, I took a lonely seat in the back.
sentences.chinese: 當演講開始時，我獨自在後面找了個座位坐下。

sentences.english: The charge for a front-row seat is $ 3.
sentences.chinese: 前排座位票價每張三美元。

sentences.english: Get many empty seat, everyone orderly and sit down.
sentences.chinese: 上車後還有許多空座位，大家都有序的坐下了。

definition: empress's throne/(fig.) first place in a feminine competition
by the window (referring to seats on a plane etc)
rickshaw seat (Beijing dialect)/patron (of teahouse, cinema)/passenger (in taxi, rickshaw etc)
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
box (in a theater or concert hall)/private room (in a restaurant or karaoke)
to sit properly/to sit up straight
